title: 111_hr4915
content: The "Federal Aviation Administration Extension Act of 2010" extends fuel and ticket taxes funding the Airport and Airway Trust Fund until July 3, 2010. The amendments made by this act will take effect on April 1, 2010. SEC. 3 extends the Airport and Airway Trust Fund expenditure authority to July 4, 2010, and includes the Federal Aviation Administration Extension Act of 2010. The effective date for these amendments is April 1, 2010. Authorization of Appropriations for the Federal Aviation Administration is extended to $3,024,657,534 from October 1, 2009, to July 3, 2010. The funds can be used until September 30, 2010, and remain available for expenditure. The Administrator of the FAA is tasked with calculating funding apportionments for various programs during this period. The funding apportionments under section 48103 for fiscal year 2010 are calculated as if $4 billion were available, then reduced by 11%. Section 47104(c) is amended to change the project grant authority deadline to July 3, 2010. SEC. 5. EXTENSION OF EXPIRING AUTHORITIES. Section 40117(l)(7) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to change the date from "April 1, 2010" to "July 4, 2010." Various other sections in the same title are also amended to update dates from March 31, 2010, June 30, 2010, and April 1, 2010, to July 3, 2010, September 30, 2010, and July 4, 2010, respectively. The amendments to various sections in the Vision 100--Century of Aviation Reauthorization Act change the effective date from April 1, 2010, to July 4, 2010. The Federal Aviation Administration operations budget for the period from October 1, 2009, to July 3, 2010, is set at $7,070,158,159. Additionally, the air navigation facilities and equipment budget for the same period is $2,220,252,132, and the research, engineering, and development budget is $144,049,315. The Surface Transportation Extension Modification Act of 2010 amends allocation rules under the Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2010. It specifies changes to section 411(d) related to apportioned funds under title 23, United States Code. The Surface Transportation Extension Modification Act of 2010 amends allocation rules under title 23, United States Code by specifying changes to section 411(d) related to apportioned funds. The Surface Transportation Extension Modification Act of 2010 amends allocation rules under title 23, United States Code by specifying changes to section 411(d) related to apportioned funds for projects of national and regional significance and national corridor infrastructure improvement programs. The Surface Transportation Extension Modification Act of 2010 amends allocation rules under title 23, United States Code by specifying changes to section 411(d) related to apportioned funds for national and regional significance projects and national corridor infrastructure improvement programs. The funds apportioned to each State are based on their share for fiscal year 2009, with distribution among specified programs in proportion to each program's share. The Surface Transportation Extension Modification Act of 2010 amends allocation rules under title 23, United States Code by specifying changes to section 411(d) related to apportioned funds for national and regional significance projects and national corridor infrastructure improvement programs. The funds apportioned to each State are based on their share for fiscal year 2009, with distribution among specified programs in proportion to each program's share. Expenditure authority from the Highway Trust Fund is also modified under the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The amendments made by this section will take effect upon the enactment of the Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2010 and will be included in that Act at the time of its enactment. The Surface Transportation Extension Act of 2010 was passed by the House of Representatives on March 24, 2010.
